data.profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born near New Glasgow (now Clifford), Amherst County, Va., September 27, 1769; pursued an academic course; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Virginia; member of the Virginia state house of delegates, 1799-1802 and 1805-1809; served in the Virginia state senate, 1809-1811; elected as a Democratic Republican to the Eleventh Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Wilson Cary Nicholas (January 17, 1810-March 3, 1811); again a member of the Virginia state house of delegates in 1814, 1815, 1819-1826, and 1832-1836; died in Clifford, Va., October 7, 1841; interment in the Meredith and Garland families' graveyard, Clifford, Va.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by resignation of Wilson Cary Nicholas, and too his seat January 17, 1810
